abstracts.cdata!:
The Village Infrastructure Project is
            aimed at reducing rural poverty.  This environmental
            assessment identifies potential environmental concerns and
            provides appropriate environmental guidelines for mitigation
            measures. In the water project subcomponents, contamination
            of surface and ground waters can be mitigated by conducting
            regular quality analyses.  Lined canals or pipes can be used
            to prevent disease vectors and seepage.  Ground water
            depletion can be reduced by ensuring that abstraction rates
            are consistent with natural aquifer recharge.  Reducing
            farming activities upstream can reduce sedimentation and
            discourage aquatic weed growth.  Salinisation may be
            controlled by leaching of salts through periodic flushing or
            soils.  In terms of rural transport infrastructure, road
            surface should be sealed with bitumen to avoid erosion.
            Frequent watering can reduce dust impacts.  Appropriate
            culverts and drifts can be used to eliminate flooding.  Axle
            loads of trucks should be regulated to avoid depressions and
            ponding.  As for the rural post-harvest infrastructure, some
            of the solid waste generated by processing equipment could
            be recycled.  Liquid waste should be analyzed to determined
            possible uses. The use of mud silos provides protection to
            dry crops and prevents bush fires.
